p: In Korean herbal medicinal practice, P. multiflorum has been cleared to treat the liver, kidney, and blood and is used to treat hemorrhoids, etc. In addition, P. multiflorum has been widely utilized in traditional remedies because of its excellent blood pressure lowering effect and potential ability to reduce arteriosclerosis [ 4]. It has various other beneficial characteristics, such as cardio protective [ 5], nerve strengthening [ 6], antioxidant [ 7], anti-aging [ 8], anti-mutation [ 9], anti-arthritis [ 10], and skin improvement [ 11] properties. Polygonum multiflorum varieties are classified into two groups: red P. multiflorum and white P. multiflorum. Their roots commonly contain approximately 45% starch and 3% crude fat [ 12].
